messages.message: Hi team, @Nithin and I are needing to find how we can access a K8s secret from within a UDF? JPMC require this for an integration for Custody fax use case - where a certificate is stored as as secret, which is then passed as part of an API call to a downstream system
The secret would have to be mounted to celery app tasks in kubernetes, which can then be accessed as an environment variable.

@kunal okay, can we do a test run using some random alpha numeric string, just so we can write a UDF that prints it out? I want to be sure that we can access the secret as part of an API call, so getting it out is the first step in this

Do we have any documentation on how this can be done, or is it best to work collaboratively to figure it out?

I don’t think there is any documentation on this specifically; I don’t think this is officially supported either. I personally haven’t seen this pattern before, so I’m not sure if any of our current customers do this.
Understood, thanks @kunal - how can we progress this with JPMC? Can we work together to figure out the approach?

I think it makes sense for sol eng to take this forward, right? I’m happy to help with guidance in case there are any issues. We should be able to try and test this out on an internal sandbox environment to do the test run as you said above.
100% doing it in Sandbox, @Nithin who can work on this independently from JPMC to confirm how we can do it, so as soon as JPMC get their certificate we can progress this?

@kunal, If there is already a secret mounted on celery app, I can try accessing this from UDF.
If there is no environment variable, Can I work with @Shubham Oli to mount this to celery on Solution-Eng sandbox to test this?
